title: Tear gas fired at peaceful protesters outside of White House
description: Peaceful protesters in Washington were tear gased outside of the White House just minutes before President Donald gave a speech in the Rose Garden declaring he will mobilize the US military to end "riots and lawlessness."

title: Fauci hasn't spoken with Trump in two weeks
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, one of the most prominent members of the White House coronavirus task force, said on Monday that he has not spoken to or met with President Donald Trump in two weeks.

title: Social distancing and masks do reduce risk of getting Covid-19, major review finds
description: Stay 6 feet apart and, while you're at it, wear a face covering. While most countries around the world have instituted simple steps like these to help stop the spread of Covid-19, the scientific evidence behind them hasn't always been clear-cut and has, in the case of masks, sometimes been contradictory.

title: Thousands around the world protest George Floyd's death in global display of solidarity
description: Protesters have marched in the US for six consecutive nights over the death of George Floyd at the hands of a police officer. Their anger over the killing of the unarmed black man has now spread worldwide.

title: The sixth mass extinction is happening faster than expected, and it's our fault
description: The sixth mass extinction is not a worry for the future. It's happening now, much faster than previously expected, and it's entirely our fault, according to a study published Monday.

title: A rare wave of public dissent from Facebook employees
description: In a rare example of public dissent, some Facebook employees are taking to Twitter to express strong disagreements with CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to take any action on a series of controversial posts last week from President Donald Trump, including an apparent threat that "looting" would lead to "shooting."

title: Houston police chief to Trump: If you can't be constructive, keep your mouth shut
description: Houston police chief Art Acevedo responds to President Trump telling governors to "dominate" protesters.

title: Shooting at US Air Force base leaves two dead
description: An early morning shooting at Grand Forks Air Force Base in North Dakota has left two active-duty military members dead.

title: Five dead in newest Ebola outbreak in Congo, UNICEF says
description: Five people, including a 15-year-old girl, have died of Ebola in a fresh outbreak of the virus in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the United Nations Children's Fund said Monday. Nine cases total have been reported, UNICEF said.

title: DOJ hits brakes on police investigations, experts say
description: During the Obama administration, high-profile police shootings of black men like Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri and Laquan McDonald in Chicago helped spark sweeping federal investigations and reforms of biased policing practices.

title: 'My emotions were so raw': The people creating art to remember George Floyd
description: In the wake of George Floyd's death at the hands of a Minneapolis police officer, artists have been quick to respond with works that seek to memorialize, to provoke and to heal.

title: SpaceX's Crew Dragon took flight in historic mission. What's next?
Mining firm sorry for blowing up 46,000-year-old sacred indigenous site
description: Mining giant Rio Tinto has apologized after blowing up a 46,000-year-old sacred indigenous site with dynamite to expand an Australian iron ore mine.

title: Sewage could hold the key to stopping new coronavirus outbreaks
description: The vast brown rivers of sludge that gush into the sewage treatment plants across Germany may hold a key to early detection of any new wave of the coronavirus, scientists tell CNN.

title: Prayer book once owned by tragic queen to be sold at auction for up to $434,000
description: A prayer book that once belonged to Mary, Queen of Scots and contains an inscription by the tragic monarch is to go on sale, with an expected price of up to £350,000 ($432,000).

title: Fox Sports anchor apologizes for 'completely inappropriate' Adolf Hitler joke
description: Fox Sports anchor Matty Johns has apologized for a "completely inappropriate" joke after a TV segment featuring a photoshopped cardboard cutout of Adolf Hitler was aired on one of the broadcaster's Australian National Rugby League shows.

title: Should you fly yet? Here's what an epidemiologist and an exposure scientist say
description: We don't know about you, but we're ready to travel. And that typically means flying.

title: John Legend says his friendship with Kanye West has evolved
description: John Legend and Kanye West are in "different places," according to the singer.

title: Cadets brought back for West Point graduation at which Trump will speak test positive
description: About 15 cadets from the US Military Academy Class of 2020 who were brought back for graduation where President Donald Trump is scheduled to give the commencement address have tested positive for coronavirus, according to a US Army spokesperson.

title: Trump is gift-wrapping a propanganda win for China
description:
• For the first time in 30 years, Hong Kong will not hold a mass vigil commemorating the Tiananmen square massacre 
• Opinion: Trump is taking a page straight from the CCP's playbook

title: Prince with coronavirus apologizes for breaking quarantine and attending party
description: A Belgian prince has apologized, after testing positive for coronavirus two days after attending a social gathering in Córdoba, Spain.

title: Boy, 9, with cerebral palsy completes marathon on his walker, half a mile at a time
description: A 9-year-old boy with cerebral palsy and autism has raised $100,000 for charity after completing a marathon up and down his street using a walker.

title: How to talk to your children about protests and racism
description: As cities and social media explode with anger over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police, worried parents struggle with how to protect their children from seeing the worst of the violence while simultaneously explaining the ravages of racism.

title: Sylvester Stallone to narrate 'emotional' new 'Rocky' documentary
description: A new "Rocky" documentary is on its way -- and it's narrated by the Italian Stallion himself, Sylvester Stallone.

title: Preschoolers are using apps meant for adults, study finds
description: Relaxing the rules on screen time for kids has become more acceptable during the pandemic as parents struggle to balance working from home with the demands of childcare, schoolwork and cabin fever.

title: Moderna set off a frenzy with its vaccine trial. Some are calling for an investigation
description: Moderna set off a frenzy on Wall Street earlier this month when it announced positive, preliminary results from its coronavirus vaccine trial. As the hype grew, the young biotech company and its leading investor wasted no time capitalizing on the briefly surging stock price.

title: First sighting of Queen Elizabeth, 94, during lockdown -- and she's on a horse
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has been pictured riding on horseback in Windsor, west of London, in her first public appearance since the coronavirus lockdown began in the UK.

title: What nudists do during a lockdown
description: On an average weekday, you might find Parisian Laurent Luft enjoying a swim at the city's Roger Le Gall swim center.

title: See police officers kneel in solidarity with protesters
description: In the midst of protests around the nation, moving scenes unfolded in New York and Coral Gables, Florida, when some of the cities' police officers knelt in solidarity with protesters.

title: Biden's in one of the best positions for any challenger since scientific polling began
Protestors face off with the forces of order in DC and New York, as crowds gather at City Hall in San Francisco
While Trump shelters in the White House, America cries out for leadership
description: • NYC mayor's daughter arrested at protest

title: Hong Kong stocks jump as investors shrug off US-China tensions
description: Hong Kong stocks are on pace for their best day since March as investors shrug off the Trump administration's intention to end a special economic and trading relationship with the Asian financial hub. There are also signs in the region that China's economy is continuing to recover from the worst of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: A serious divide exists among Trump advisers over how to address nights of protests and riots in US after Floyd's death
Cities extend curfews for another night in an attempt to avoid violent protests over George Floyd's death
Christo, who made monumental art around the world, has died at 84
description: Christo Vladimirov Javacheff, who was known for his monumental environmental artworks with his late wife, Jeanne-Claude Denat de Guillebon, has died. He was 84 years old.

title: Trump taken to underground bunker during protests
description: As protesters gathered outside the White House Friday night in Washington, DC, President Donald Trump was briefly taken to the underground bunker for a period of time, according to a White House official and a law enforcement source.

title: Truck drives through protesters in Minnesota
description: A truck driver has been arrested after driving through protesters in Minnesota, according to Governor Tim Walz.

title: CNN turns 40 today. Here's what it was like on Day One
description: The world's first 24-hour news network came to life on June 1, 1980. Watch a behind the scenes look at what CNN looked like on its first day.

title: Floyd family questions Minneapolis police chief on live TV
description: CNN's Sara Sidner stops mid sentence to ask the Minneapolis Police Chief Medaria Arradondo a question on behalf of George Floyd's family. This was the first direct communication the Floyd family has had with the police department.

title: What we do and don't know about US extremists
description: Law enforcement and federal officials say outside elements from both far-right and far-left groups are helping fuel the violent and damaging confrontations that have marred protests across the country in recent days, despite President Donald Trump's focus just on Antifa and the far left.

title: The Asian billionaire who made a fortune from war
description: When Stanley Ho Hung-sun, the man who made Macao a global gambling mecca, died at age 98 this week he was reportedly worth $14.9 billion.

title: Sheriff takes off riot gear and joins protesters
description: Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson spoke with demonstrators who were met by police officers in riot gear and then joined the protest, according to CNN affiliate WEYI.
